alert.note: Alert for Giles (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 11:03AM CST until January 18 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County. For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Richland Creek Above Pulaski. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Portions of Vales Mill Rd between Chicken Creek Rd and the Highway 64 bypass become inundated and may be subject to closure * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 18.2 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling today and tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM CST.
